intro: Achyronia triquetra, commonly known as the three-lobed liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Peltasporaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure with a leafy stem and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves. It reproduces via spores released from specialized structures called sporocarps. Achyronia triquetra is often found in temperate regions and is an indicator species for undisturbed, humid habitats.
